00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements named variables
00004 #
00005 package Parser::Variable;
00006 use strict; no strict "refs";
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Item);
00008 
00009 $Parser::class->{Variable} = 'Parser::Variable';
00010 
00011 #
00012 #  Error if the variable is not declared in the current context.
00013 #  Record the variable in the equation's list of variables.
00014 #
00015 sub new {
00016   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00017   my $equation = shift; my $variables = $equation->{context}{variables};
00018   my ($name,$ref) = @_;
00019   unless ($variables->{$name}) {
00020     my $string = substr($equation->{string},$ref->[2]);
00021     if ($string =~ m/^([a-z][a-z]+)/i) {
00022       $ref->[3] = $ref->[2]+length($1);
00023       $equation->Error(["'%s' is not defined in this context",$1],$ref);
00024     }
00025     $equation->Error(["Variable '%s' is not defined in this context",$name],$ref);
00026   }
00027   $equation->Error(["Variable '%s' is not defined in this context",$name],$ref)
00028     if $variables-> {$name}{parameter} && $equation->{context}{flags}{no_parameters};
00029   $equation->{variables}{$name} = 1;
00030   my $def = $variables->{$name};
00031   my $v = bless {
00032     name => $name, def => $def, type => $def->{type},
00033     ref => $ref, equation => $equation
00034   }, $class;
00035   $v->weaken;
00036   return $v;
00037 }
00038 
00039 #
00040 #  Replace the variable with its value, if one was given
00041 #
00042 sub reduce {
00043   my $self = shift; my $equation = $self->{equation};
00044   my $value = $equation->{values}{$self->{name}};
00045   $self = $self->Item("Value")->new($equation,[$value]) if defined($value);
00046   return $self;
00047 }
00048 
00049 #
00050 #  Substitute a variable's value, if there is one
00051 #
00052 sub substitute {
00053   my $self = shift; my $equation = $self->{equation};
00054   my $value = $equation->{values}{$self->{name}};
00055   $self = $self->Item("Value")->new($equation,[$value]) if defined($value);
00056   return $self;
00057 }
00058 
00059 #
00060 #  Replace the variable with its value, if one was given
00061 #
00062 sub eval {
00063   my $self = shift;
00064   my $value = $self->{equation}{values}{$self->{name}};
00065   return $value if defined($value);
00066   $self->Error("No value given for variable '%s'",$self->{name});
00067 }
00068 
00069 #
00070 #  Add the variable name to the equation's list of variables
00071 #    unless the variable has been assigned a value
00072 #
00073 sub getVariables {
00074   my $self = shift; my $variables = $self->{equation}{variables};
00075   return {} if defined($self->{equation}{values}{$self->{name}});
00076   return {$self->{name} => 1};
00077 }
00078 
00079 #
00080 #  Copy the variable, and add the name to the new equation's list
00081 #
00082 sub copy {
00083   my $self = shift;
00084   $self = $self->SUPER::copy(@_);
00085   my $variables = $self->{equation}{variables};
00086   $variables->{$self->{name}} = 1
00087     unless defined($self->{equation}{values}{$self->{name}});
00088   return $self;
00089 }
00090 
00091 #
00092 #  Return the variable's name or value
00093 #
00094 sub string {
00095   my $self = shift;
00096   my $value = $self->{equation}{values}{$self->{name}};
00097   return $value if defined($value);
00098   return $self->{name};
00099 }
00100 #
00101 #  Make a subscripted variable name if it ends in numbers
00102 #
00103 sub TeX {
00104   my $self = shift; my $name = $self->{name};
00105   my $value = $self->{equation}{values}{$name};
00106   return $value if defined($value);
00107   return $self->{def}{TeX} if defined $self->{def}{TeX};
00108   $name = $1.'_{'.$2.'}' if ($name =~ m/^([^_]+)_?(\d+)$/);
00109   $name = '\boldsymbol '.$name if $self->{type}{name} eq 'Vector';
00110   return $name;
00111 }
00112 #
00113 #  Make a variable reference
00114 #
00115 sub perl {
00116   my $self = shift;
00117   my $value = $self->{equation}{values}{$self->{name}};
00118   return $value if defined($value);
00119   my $perl = $self->{def}{perl} || '$'.$self->{name};
00120   substr($perl,1) =~ s/([^a-z0-9_])/"_".ord($1)/ge;
00121   return $perl;
00122 }
